name: biomni-get-plasmid-sequence
title: Biomni: Get Plasmid Sequence
description: Retrieve plasmid sequences from Addgene or NCBI databases
content:
Overview

This tool retrieves plasmid sequences from major public repositories including Addgene and NCBI. It automatically searches both databases to find plasmid sequences by ID number (for Addgene) or name (for NCBI), returning the complete sequence along with annotations, features, and metadata. This is essential for obtaining reference sequences before ordering plasmids or planning cloning strategies.

Input Parameters

  • identifier: Plasmid identifier - Addgene ID number (e.g., "12345") or NCBI plasmid name (e.g., "pUC19")
  • --addgene: Optional flag to force Addgene database lookup only
  • --ncbi: Optional flag to force NCBI database lookup only

Biological Use Case

Essential for accessing validated plasmid sequences:

  • Obtain sequences of commonly used expression vectors
  • Retrieve plasmids from Addgene before ordering
  • Download reference sequences for subcloning projects
  • Access annotated plasmid maps for experimental planning
  • Verify plasmid identity using sequence comparison
  • Obtain vector backbones for in silico cloning design

Output

Returns a parameters (e.g., plasmid_12345.json) containing the complete plasmid sequence, annotations, features, size, and database metadata.

Category

molecular_biology
command: rm -rf prod_apps 2>/dev/null || true && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/CamberCloud-Inc/prod_apps.git prod_apps && python3 prod_apps/biomni/molecular_biology/get_plasmid_sequence.py "${identifier}" ${addgene} ${ncbi} -o "${outputDir}"
